Pre-Game Insights: Carlos Rodón needs to pitch like he did for half the season to help the Yankees win their 28th World Series title.
Giancarlo Stanton's determination to win a title has carried him this far, but it will be truly fascinating if he can keep up this pace in the World Series.
Luke Weaver has answered the bell almost every step of the way and has exceeded expectations since being promoted to earn saves.
Gleyber Torres has had a love-hate relationship with the Bronx fan base, but he's received nothing but support from those that know him best within the organization.
Jazz Chisholm has cooled off considerably at the plate, but the Yankees don't necessarily need him to display the power he did when initially acquired from Miami.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees have been involved in several close games this postseason, but they've yet to be in a close series.
The heavyweight matchup between the Yankees and Dodgers is sure to test the depth of both rosters.
The Yankees have to hope that the workload hasn't caught up to Carlos Rodón, who recorded 16 quality starts out of a career-high 32 outings and 175 innings pitched this season.
Others: The Yankees' lineup boasts Juan Soto and Aaron Judge before Giancarlo Stanton even gets to the on-deck circle.
The Yankees' roster is so buttoned up that it can sometimes come off as boring.
The acquisition of Jazz Chisholm proved to be a huge success right away, slugging nine home runs and collecting 14 RBIs in his first 20 games with the Bombers.
